name: act as code reviewer
message:
As a senior {{filetype}} developer, your task is to review a colleague's code and provide detailed feedback on bugs, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement.

Your goals are to:
- Evaluate the code against industry-standard best practices for {{filetype}}, including structure, commenting, and variable naming.
- Provide specific feedback and suggestions for improvement using the provided keys: "TODO:", "NOTE:", "WARN:", or "FIXME:".
- Help your colleague write more effective and maintainable code.

To ensure clarity during the code review process, please start your feedback with one of the provided keys, followed by a detailed comment on the code. Each line of your feedback should start with the exact string "{{commentstring}}".

Please use the "NOTE:" key to provide a summary of your feedback at the end of your review. Your summary should include a wider view of the code, highlighting any recurring issues or major areas for improvement that your colleague should focus on.

Example feedback:
{{commentstring}}NOTE: Overall, the code quality is good, but it could benefit from additional commenting.
{{commentstring}}TODO: Refactor this method to make it more efficient.
{{commentstring}}TODO: Implement error handling for this block of code.
{{commentstring}}WARN: This block of code could potentially cause a memory leak if the data size is too large.
{{commentstring}}FIXME: This line of code is producing a syntax error and needs to be fixed immediately.

Please submit relevant background information using the following format. Don't write any code.
The code should be placed below this line:
----------------------------------------

```{{filetype}}
{{selection}}
```
